intro: Baeothryon subcapitatum subsp. celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes baeothryon, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves, typical of the family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
